```{r, echo = FALSE, results = "hide"}
# Generate random question parameters
sf <- 3 # Number of significant figures to use
v <- signif(sample(10:99, 1), sf) # speed in km/h
t <- signif(sample(10:99, 1), sf) # time in minutes

# Calculate the correct answer and distractors
answer <- signif(v*(t/60), sf)
distractors <- c(signif(v*t, 3))
sc <- num_to_schoice(answer, wrong = distractors, range = c(answer/10, v*t), delta = 0.05*answer, format = FALSE)
sc$questions <- sapply(sc$questions, signif, sf)

# Format numbers
sc$questions <- sprintf("%g km", sc$questions)
v <- format(v, digits=sf, nsmall = 1)
t <- format(t, digits=sf, nsmall = 1)
```

Question
========
Suppose an object travels at a constant velocity of `r v` km/h. What distance would it travel in `r t` minutes?

```{r questionlist, echo = FALSE, results = "asis"}
answerlist(sc$questions, markup = "markdown")
```

Solution
========
Use the formula for constant velocity motion making sure to convert to the proper units.

$$ d = vt = (\SI{`r v`}{km/h})(\SI{`r t`}{min})\left(\frac{\SI{1}{h}}{\SI{60}{min}} \right) = `r answer` \,\mathsf{km}$$
